title: Google AI Pro gets cheaper with new $200 annual plan
description: Google now offers a $200 annual plan for AI Pro, saving users money on advanced Gemini, Gmail, and Docs features. The post Google AI Pro gets cheaper with new $200 annual plan appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Tyler Lee
excerpt: Google now offers a $200 annual plan for AI Pro, saving users money on advanced Gemini, Gmail, and Docs features.
text: Good news for anyone using Google’s advanced AI features. Google has quietly rolled out a new annual subscription option for its AI Pro plan. This cuts the price to $200 per year. That’s a welcome change from the $20-per-month setup it launched with. Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge Review (SAVE $400!) Previously, subscribing to Google AI Pro meant paying $240 a year with no way to save. The new annual plan, spotted by 9to5Google, effectively gives you two months free if you’re in it for the long term. The subscription unlocks enhanced AI tools across several Google apps. This includes faster and more capable access to Gemini 2.5 Pro, better writing and brainstorming help in Gmail and Docs, and upgraded support for image and video generation. Google has also teased that Pro users may get early access to future AI features. The core AI tools in Google Search and other services remain free. But the Pro plan is aimed at users who want deeper integration and higher limits across the board. At $200 a year, it’s a more budget-friendly option. Especially for those relying on Google’s AI for work, creativity, or productivity. Whether you’re writing emails, drafting documents, or experimenting with AI-generated visuals, the new pricing makes it easier to stick with Pro long term. A graphic novelist wannabe. Amateur chef. Mechanical keyboard enthusiast. Writer of tech with over a decade of experience. Juggles between using a Mac and Windows PC, switches between iOS and Android, believes in the best of both worlds. html:
Good news for anyone using Google’s advanced AI features. Google has quietly rolled out a new annual subscription option for its AI Pro plan. This cuts the price to $200 per year. That’s a welcome change from the $20-per-month setup it launched with.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge Review (SAVE $400!)

Previously, subscribing to Google AI Pro meant paying $240 a year with no way to save. The new annual plan, spotted by 9to5Google, effectively gives you two months free if you’re in it for the long term.

The subscription unlocks enhanced AI tools across several Google apps. This includes faster and more capable access to Gemini 2.5 Pro, better writing and brainstorming help in Gmail and Docs, and upgraded support for image and video generation. Google has also teased that Pro users may get early access to future AI features.

The core AI tools in Google Search and other services remain free. But the Pro plan is aimed at users who want deeper integration and higher limits across the board.

At $200 a year, it’s a more budget-friendly option. Especially for those relying on Google’s AI for work, creativity, or productivity. Whether you’re writing emails, drafting documents, or experimenting with AI-generated visuals, the new pricing makes it easier to stick with Pro long term.

A graphic novelist wannabe. Amateur chef. Mechanical keyboard enthusiast. Writer of tech with over a decade of experience. Juggles between using a Mac and Windows PC, switches between iOS and Android, believes in the best of both worlds.
